Title.evidence: High-Sensitivity Cardiac Troponin T in Detecting Perioperative Myocardial Infarction: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Participants.evidence: Participants included 605 patients with baseline and at least one postoperative hscTnT value.

Intervention.evidence: evaluate the effectiveness of a high-sensitivity cardiac troponin T (hscTnT) assay compared to contemporary cardiac troponin I (cTnI)

Objective.evidence: The study aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a high-sensitivity cardiac troponin T (hscTnT) assay compared to contemporary cardiac troponin I (cTnI) in detecting perioperative myocardial infarction (MI) after non-cardiac surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of myocardial injury and MI, assessed using various hscTnT change metrics.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Among 605 patients, 70 (12%) had ECG changes consistent with myocardial ischemia.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Using contemporary cTnI, 82 patients (14%) were diagnosed with myocardial injury, with 31 (5.1%) having an adjudicated MI. The hscTnT assay identified 67 patients (11%) with MI, doubling the detection rate.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.
